steps.title: Mix 1/2-3/4 cups of sugar, 2 cups of warm water, and 2 teaspoons of yeast together.
steps.content: Mix 1/2-3/4 cups of sugar, 2 cups of warm water, and 2 teaspoons of yeast together.

steps.title: Set the mixture aside.
steps.content: Set the mixture aside. Let it sit for approximately 5 minutes.

steps.title: Add 2 1/2 cups of flour to it.
steps.content: Add 2 1/2 cups of flour to it. Mix until it's smooth and not lumpy.

steps.title: Cover the batter with foil.
steps.content: Cover the batter with foil. Let it rise for approximately 1 to 2 hours.

steps.title: Pour oil in a frying pan on your stove.
steps.content: Pour oil in a frying pan on your stove. Put a little drop of the batter to the oil in order to see if it's hot enough; it should sizzle and start cooking immediately if the oil is hot enough.

steps.title: Use a spoon to gather up the batter and another spoon to form it into a ball.
steps.content: Use a spoon to gather up the batter and another spoon to form it into a ball. Drop it in the hot oil.

steps.title: Fry the batter until the bottom is golden brown.
steps.content: Fry the batter until the bottom is golden brown.

steps.title: Flip and fry the other side until its golden brown as well.
steps.content: Flip and fry the other side until its golden brown as well.

steps.title: Use a large slotted spoon to take the puff-puff out the oil.
steps.content: Use a large slotted spoon to take the puff-puff out the oil.

steps.title: Use paper towels to soak up any excess oil.
steps.content: Use paper towels to soak up any excess oil.

steps.title: Add powdered sugar to it.
steps.content: Add powdered sugar to it. Serve and enjoy!
